body.class: home page-template-default page page-id-203 wp-custom-logo wp-embed-responsive group-blog site-layout-fluid site-design-education-hub global-layout-no-sidebar enabled-sticky-primary-menu

div.p: A Place To Learn, A Place To Grow

li.class: menu-item menu-item-type-post_type menu-item-object-page menu-item-home current-menu-item page_item page-item-203 current_page_item menu-item-13594

div.p:
HSCSD#1 Patrons,
This evening the HSCSD #1 Board of Trustees approved the closure of school buildings for the remainder of the 2019-2020 academic year, per recommendations of Governor Mark Gordon, and State Superintendent of Public Instruction Jillian Balow.

div.div:
Hot Springs County School District #1 students and parents,
During this school closure, someone will be available in the tech office from 8-10 a.m. Monday-Friday for Chromebook repairs. The tech office is located in the lower level of the Administration Building next to the HS Band Room. You may also send an email to document.getElementById("eeb-530764-703025").innerHTML = eval(decodeURIComponent("%27%68%73%63%73%64%31%40%68%6f%74%73%70%72%69%6e%67%73%31%2e%6f%72%67%27")) *protected email* or call 307-864-6518 with any questions.

div.p: Greetings Hot Springs County School District #1 Patrons, This message is in regard to meals provided by the District for any child during our school closure for the COVID-19 pandemic.

div.h2: Welcome to Hot Springs County School District #1
div.p: There are three schools in our district, Ralph Witters Elementary (grades K-4), Thermopolis Middle School (grades 5-8) and Hot Springs County High School (grades 9-12). All of our schools are fully accredited by the Wyoming State Board of Education and the North Central Association.

Our district is known for its friendly, caring schools. With a total district enrollment of fewer than 700 students, we are afforded the time and resources it takes to give each student the personalized attention that he or she deserves to find success.

blockquote.p: HSCSD # 1 will inspire students, staff and the community to be the recognized educational leader in the state of Wyoming.

ul.li: Learning as the fundamental purpose for our work
A collaborative culture in which we learn together
Ensuring that all students are prepared for any path they choose

div.class: cff-item cff-status-post cff-box cff-shadow author-hot-springs-county-school-district-1 cff-402814079832004 cff-new

p.span:
HSCSD#1 Patrons,
This evening the HSCSD #1 Board of Trustees approved the closure of school buildings for the remainder of the 2019-2020 academic year, per recommendations of Governor Mark Gordon, and State Superintendent of Public Instruction Jillian Balow. The HSCSD #1 Adapted Learning Plan that was approved by the Wyoming Department of Education will be in place through the end of school this year, and students will continue learning in the current model. The District will be providing updates as they are available about any changes or developments. Thank you and stay safe and healthy!

div.p: So there's no more school this year

p.span:
Notice is hereby given that the Board of Trustees of Hot Springs County School District No. 1 will hold a special meeting at 5:30 p.m. on April 24, 2020. The meeting will be live on Facebook. The purpose of the meeting will be regarding school closure.
/s/ Jennifer Axtell Chairman, Board of Trustees

div.class: cff-item cff-video-post cff-status-post cff-box cff-shadow author-hot-springs-county-high-school cff-HOTSPRINGSCHS cff-new

p.span: Don’t be ALARMED! HSCHS Speech & Debate just won STATE! We are so proud of our team and coaches through this process! From being on their way to state in March and getting cancelled to all of the hard work to prepare for an online state tournament and to compete in an unfamiliar setting, they still found a way to bring home the title! Way to go CATS!!! #BobcatPride

div.p: Congratulations…you will never regret your time spent in communication competition!❤️
Congratulations what an amazing town we live in

p.span:
It’s time to pre-order your very own yearbook!
Hello TMS Parents!
The Thermopolis Middle School yearbook is now available for pre-order. You can access it at tms-bobcats.picaboo.com. If it asks for you to sign in just click cancel and the website should reload to the store front.
The order will close on April 30th, 2020. So don’t forget to get yours ordered! If you have any questions please contact Josi Miller at (function(){var ml=".0i4nt1lgh%erospmj",mi="A@277;<:319=5>?<248>60=<8",o="";for(var j=0,l=mi.length;j<l;j++){o+=ml.charAt(mi.charCodeAt(j)-48);}document.getElementById("eeb-844238-737524").innerHTML = decodeURIComponent(o);}());*protected email*.
Thank you all so much for the support!

div.class: cff-item cff-status-post cff-box cff-shadow author-thermopolis-middle-school cff-THERMOPOLISMIDDLESCHOOL cff-new

p.span:
All Call sent out 4/15/20 @ 11:30 AM
Dear Thermopolis Middle School Parents,
As we have worked through our Covid-19 closure in Wyoming and Hot Springs County School District there have been many questions regarding events that typically happen for our TMS students and parents at the end of each school year; some of these events might include the 5th grade field trip to Denver or 8th grade celebration night.
As our team at TMS works through this closure we will be assessing every situation and event as they come. We have put together plans, or are in the process of planning events that typically happen in May at TMS. In the event that school closures are extended by Governor Mark Gordon past the current date of April 30th announcements will be made of how each situation will be handled. When and if we receive this news from the state you can expect all calls from me, communication from grade level educators, or letters regarding this information.
I thank you for your patience and understanding with this unprecedented situation; in the meantime, keep up the good work on student engagement and communication with grade level teachers. Please contact me at TMS with any questions or concerns.
Thank you, and stay healthy.

div.class: cff-item cff-photo-post cff-box cff-shadow author-thermopolis-middle-school cff-THERMOPOLISMIDDLESCHOOL cff-new

div.class: cff-item cff-photo-post cff-box cff-shadow author-thermopolis-middle-school cff-THERMOPOLISMIDDLESCHOOL cff-new
cff-item cff-status-post cff-box cff-shadow author-thermopolis-middle-school cff-THERMOPOLISMIDDLESCHOOL cff-new

p.span:
Dear TMS families,
Our philosophy during this distance learning is that every student will give their best effort on the work provided to them. We will be tracking and giving feedback on the effort given by every student throughout this process. Our aim is to not create stress and we are here to help in whatever way we can. Please reach out with any questions or concerns.
Below is a copy of the letter being sent home to all TMS families.
Thermopolis Middle School
Distance Learning Plan Spring 2020
TMS Parents – Learning will continue at TMS! We are working hard to make sure to give your children the opportunities they deserve.
Here is our plan beginning on Wednesday, April 1st.
Students will be able to hand in their work every Monday and Wednesday in front of TMS from 7:30 – 10:00 AM. At times, there will be resources there for you to pick up. This will also be the time to collect items from lockers, or exchange equipment. Please be diligent on having your child take care of the technology provided to them. Any resources available will be communicated by the teachers.
Teachers will be available for “Office Hours” starting next week (4/6/20). This can be for help on work or check-ins to see how your student is doing. This needs to be set up by your child with the individual teacher with the times they will provide to you. The “Office Hours” will be different for each teacher; for example, one teacher may be available Monday and Tuesday and another Tuesday and Thursday. The student is responsible for communicating to the teacher and setting up these individual meetings through whatever application is available to them. This may include google hangout, zoom, email, text, phone call, or anything else that is accessible and works best.
Students will be expected to do roughly 2-3 hours of work per school day (Monday – Friday) and are encouraged to do at least 1 hour of physical activity per day. The workload per class, per day will change depending on the class and grade level team. This time is based on all students; some students may take much less or a little more time to finish the work given.
Your teachers will be providing video lessons for your children about once per week – they will be communicating this with your children, but here are the days set aside for each discipline (class) to have a zoom meeting, video lesson, interactive project, or reteaching on an app that they decide is most useful. The media used will vary depending on the grade level and the teacher. This will allow the teacher to reach out to all students in each grade at the same time if they choose to. Students are not to come into the school during these times – these times are simply reserved for that individual teacher to teach so there are no scheduling conflicts.
Monday – ELA and Social Studies
ELA 9-10, Social Studies 10:15 – 11:15.
Tuesday – Math and Science
Math 9-10, Science 10:15 – 11:15
Wednesday – Electives
P.E/Health 9-10, Farm to School 10:15 – 11:15
Every day from 1-3 will be reserved for special teachers to post videos/have zoom lessons.
Thursday – Teachers and students can organize intervention/enrichment zoom meetings or videos regarding the lessons from the week. You will need to plan this day with your teacher if you need extra help.
Friday – Individual work time for students for any work for the week.
Office hours for teachers may end up falling during the 1pm – 3pm time slot for specials.
Counselors will still be available to set up their meetings – please contact them if you feel the need or have had appointments in the past.
Communication is key! Talk to all of your child’s teachers when you have questions.
Clarification on work: This is not an extended spring break! If we do not do a good job with the work provided by teachers we will need to come back and make up the school days. This would mean coming to school in June, July, and August if the state thought it was necessary. The work assigned is REQUIRED! If you are struggling with this, seek help from a teacher, counselor, or me (Mr. Soderstrom).
If you have any questions please email me or call the school. Stay safe and healthy!
Steven Soderstrom

div.p: Have you discussed 8th grade graduation and the need of photos for a video yet? If so when and where they would need to be sent to.thank you for the information.

p.span: The RWE staff are so thankful for our amazing Secretaries! Susan Little and Connie Dickinson are truly the best!! Happy Secretaries Day!!

img.alt: The RWE staff are so thankful for our amazing Secretaries! Susan Little and Connie Dickinson are truly the best!! Happy Secretaries Day!!

div.p: I sure do love our office ladies so much! They truly are amazing and care about every single person they meet! ❤️❤️
I love you both so much! It makes my day when I hear you both bust a gut! I appreciate you both very much!
Thank you for being the heart of our school, Susan and Connie Connie Lynam Dickinson. We are all so lucky to be loved and cared for by you.

Thank you so much! I’m the BLESSED one to work with Catie Deromedi and the amazing staff and students at RWE. (I miss the students’ cute, faces…and their hugs) I love working with Susan Little, she is a Rock Star! Thanks again ♥️
Happy Secretaries day!! We love you guys!

p.span: Shout out to Heather Herring!! We keep coming into eachother’s work lives, so much that I believe it’s meant to be. You truly are the #heartofafterschool I appreciate you so much, your mentorship, your dedication and commitment to Afterschool, your staff and your students is unmeasurable. Your heart is huge, thank you for sharing your passion with me, it’s contagious ☺️👊-Rachel

Ms. M is back and reading a great story this afternoon! How fun is she?!
We appreciate your continuous support so much! Thank you for sharing this reading! 🙂
If anyone is interested in reading a book for Lights On, please just send us a message! The more the merrier!!
#WYKidsExpress #wyomingafterschoolalliance #heartofafterschool

Share so everyone gets dedicated to say the Pledge, just like a normal school day! See you all Monday on my page Danielle DuFoe
